image.altText: Two women smiling and wearing party hats as they play with a pet dog.

props.synopsis: Despite our screens being filled with images of happy families celebrating Christmas, some feel the festive season is lonelier than ever.

title.children: Quelling the holiday blues this Christmas by celebrating with your chosen family

image.altText: A topless soldier in Vietnamese jungle.

props.synopsis: Alice Springs war veteran Geoffrey Shaw OAM has been remembered as a tireless advocate for Indigenous rights in Central Australia, who leaves a legacy of courage and service.

title.children: Vietnam veteran and land rights champion remembered for courage, service

image.altText: A man applies a paperbark splint to a woman's ankle

props.synopsis: Lying on the ground with her ankle snapped in half in the remote bushland of western Arnhem Land, her mind racing, and with no help or phone reception, Margie Moroney began to crawl.

title.children: Woman survives 500-metre crawl with broken ankle in remote Arnhem Land

image.altText: A multi-storey office building behind a fence.

props.synopsis: Legal Aid NT pauses all grants of aid for December, meaning people in the territory held in custody over Christmas — including children — will not have access to a legal aid lawyer.

title.children: Low-income adults and kids in jail denied lawyers over Christmas

image.altText: A building painted in black and brown reads: NAAJA.

props.synopsis: The North Australian Aboriginal Justice Agency says hundreds of people are likely being held on remand in Northern Territory jails "unlawfully and unconstitutionally".

title.children: Lawyers launch High Court challenge to 'unconstitutional' NT bail laws

image.altText: Woman in an Australia post high visibility top is sorting the mail and smiling

props.synopsis: A disability enterprise is partnering with Australia Post to deliver mail to Aboriginal town camps around Alice Springs.

title.children: Meet the Alice Springs disability enterprise delivering mail to town camps

image.altText: A satellite map showing Tropical Cyclone Grant.

props.synopsis: Tropical Cyclone Grant is expected to remain a category one system as it passes just to the north of the Cocos (Keeling) Islands off the West Australian coast.

title.children: Christmas Day cyclone greets remote Australian islands

image.altText: A US military helicopter flying over a large oil tanker at sea.

props.synopsis: The White House has ordered US military forces to focus almost exclusively on enforcing the "quarantine" of Venezuelan oil, a US official says.

title.children: White House official says US forces to focus on 'quarantine' of Venezuela

image.altText: Peter Drew pastes up a poster

props.synopsis: An Adelaide street artist's poster aimed at provoking thought about national identity has been vandalised with racist graffiti.

title.children: 'Aussie' poster in Adelaide vandalised with 'white power' graffiti

image.altText: Joffrs Archer during England's tour match at Lilac Hill.

props.synopsis: England's disastrous Ashes tour has received another blow with Jofra Archer ruled out of the remaining two Tests while skipper Ben Stokes has dug in to defend his beleaguered team.

title.children: Stokes defends teammates as Archer's Ashes ends

image.altText: A view of the top of a red and white lighthouse looking down a river, with a super maxi and other boats in the background.

props.synopsis: A fellowship of sailors will embark on She's 23rd Sydney to Hobart campaign. As they do they will honour one of the most resilient boats in the race's history and remember late owner Peter Rodgers.

title.children: 'We push it to the max': She ready to add to Sydney to Hobart history

image.altText: A woman modelling on an outdoor runway in the golden hour.

props.synopsis: Almost three years ago, a region in Western Australia's far north was devastated by once-in-a-century floods. Now fashion is stepping in, to heal scars and promote confidence.

title.children: Fashion helps to heal community years after floods

image.altText: Erin Rolandsen and her husband, both wearing sunglasses, take a smiling selfie in front of a city skyline.

props.synopsis: More Australian relationships are struggling because of political divides. But experts say this does not have to be the end.

title.children: This couple is on opposite sides of the political divide. Here's how they make it work

image.altText: Papyrus

props.synopsis: Songwriters living in ancient Egypt would never have expected the words and melodies they sung would feature on Australian music charts 1,800 years later.

title.children: How voice memos helped bring an 1,800-year-old first hymn back to life

image.altText: A girl with brown hair and a brown hoodie sits at the window seat of a the vline train and looks at the camera

props.synopsis: Budget-conscious travellers are turning to long-haul trips on public transport to get home for Christmas, but overcrowding and delays in the regions can cause headaches.

title.children: Long public transport trips are now a go-to for holiday homecomings

image.altText: A woman shows off two diamond rings

props.synopsis: Diamonds are generally considered a luxury asset that holds its value, but the emergence of laboratory-grown diamonds in the jewellery industry over recent years could challenge that belief.

title.children: What you need to know before you buy lab-grown versus natural diamonds

image.altText: Vintage shopping

props.synopsis: The rising popularity of second-hand and vintage fashion has been viewed as an opportunity to reduce fast fashion consumption; however, Australia remains one of the world's highest waste producers.

title.children: How second-hand shopping could be fuelling consumption

image.altText: Dog with Christmas antlers under a Christmas tree

props.synopsis: Do you know your Merry Gentlemen from you Three Kings? Your Dancers from your Prancers?

title.children: Quiz: How well do you know traditional Christmas carols?

image.altText: A composite image showing three young men and one young woman that police wish to speak with.

props.synopsis: Police are searching for at least seven more people allegedly involved in an assault last Thursday, which left a Norwegian tourist with a broken arm and facial injuries.

title.children: Man charged over alleged assault of tourist on Melbourne pier

image.altText: Jeffrey Epstein smiles with what looks like a teenager, with a redacted face.

props.synopsis: The US government says newly released documents from the Epstein files contain "untrue and sensationalist" claims about Donald Trump.

title.children: 'Fake' note about Trump in Epstein files, Justice Department says

image.altText: A pool framed by palm trees, with the ocean and people walking along a promenade in the background.

props.synopsis: An American equity firm plans to purchase the jewel of the Whitsundays.

title.children: $1.2 billion Hamilton Island sale labelled 'extraordinary'

image.altText: Generic image of a phone displaying a folder of social media apps

props.synopsis: Leaders in Germany, France, Spain and the European Union slam the move as "intimidation and coercion".

title.children: US sanctions five Europeans involved in regulating tech companies

image.altText: People swim near a reef at Trigg Beach

props.synopsis: A 12-year-old girl is in a critical condition after a surfer pulled her unresponsive from the water at Trigg Beach on Tuesday.

title.children: Girl found unresponsive in water at Perth beach after being caught in rip

image.altText: Close up of Louis Vuitton branded bag.

props.synopsis: Two armed offenders allegedly forced the occupant of a house north of Hobart to open a safe, escaping with about $10,000 worth of Louis Vuitton items, police say.

title.children: '$10,000 worth of Louis Vuitton' stolen in alleged home invasion

image.altText: Dayana Yastremska hits a backhand, with an image of her trailing behind.

props.synopsis: There is a state of mind athletes talk about when they are totally absorbed in the moment and the actions of their sport.

title.children: In sport, music and even maths, finding 'the zone' is a beautiful thing

image.altText: A middle-aged man in a suit with blue tie speaks as older blonde woman in glasses stands behind

props.synopsis: Premier Chris Minns says some of the tougher laws on guns and protests in the wake of the Bondi Beach attack will go into effect immediately after the NSW Parliament passed a package of changes in the early hours of Wednesday morning.

title.children: Protest, gun laws won't stop Invasion Day rallies, NSW Premier says

image.altText: Sheik Abdulghani Albaf infront of a sign

props.synopsis: A NSW Islamic school could face de-registration if it does not provide evidence its principal is "fit and proper".

title.children: Islamic school faces de-registration over comments about Zionism

image.altText: A multi-storey office building behind a fence.

props.synopsis: Legal Aid NT pauses all grants of aid for December, meaning people in the territory held in custody over Christmas — including children — will not have access to a legal aid lawyer.

title.children: Low-income adults and kids in jail denied lawyers over Christmas

image.altText: A clip-on device with green and red buttons

props.synopsis: Duress alarms, often used by healthcare workers in high-risk settings, are being handed out by a regional Victorian council to boost elected representatives' safety.

title.children: Councillors given 'panic buttons' after threats from public

image.altText: Women perform a traditional dance.

props.synopsis: In 2024 a nurse reported racist abuse from some residents and family members. A year later, instances of abuse have plummeted and staff say it is because of a new program promoting respect.

title.children: How a nursing home tackled racism by celebrating culture

image.altText: A topless soldier in Vietnamese jungle.

props.synopsis: Alice Springs war veteran Geoffrey Shaw OAM has been remembered as a tireless advocate for Indigenous rights in Central Australia, who leaves a legacy of courage and service.

title.children: Vietnam veteran and land rights champion remembered for courage, service

image.altText: Donald Trump in a blue suit and red tie smiling while holding a blue smartphone in the Oval Office

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says he wants the United States to lead the world in the "6G race" and has given his government one year to find out how to begin making it happen.

title.children: Trump wants the US to lead on 6G. Here's when Australia could get it

image.altText: Sign outside the Hobart Private Hospital

props.synopsis: The operator of the Hobart Private Hospital has agreed to sell the facility to Catholic healthcare provider Calvary, leading to concerns about access to surgical abortions, vasectomies and some other legal procedures.

title.children: Hospital sale leads to concerns about private abortion access in Hobart

image.altText: Liam lies in a hospital bed smiling.

props.synopsis: Liam Ganter does not remember the crash that nearly killed him, but he is living with the consequences, and hopes his story will stop others making the same mistake.

title.children: Young motorcyclist issues warning after life-changing crash
